com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.networkconnection
Class NetworkConnectionTest

java.lang.Object
  junit.framework.Assert
      junit.framework.TestCase
          com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.TestBase
              com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.MediaSessionBase
                  com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.networkconnection.NetworkConnectionTest
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class NetworkConnectionTest
extends MediaSessionBase

Verify that a NetworkConnection can be setup in the two main modes: with an offer provided as argument (received from a user agent from example), or without an offer (as when performing an outgoing call). As an interesting usecase, verify that two NetworkConnections can be setup by exchanging their local and remote SDP.
This is actually creating a loopback RTP stream on the media server, and is used as a tool by many other testcases, see SipPhoneEmulator and LoopbackMediaGroup.
NoteBasic usage of a NetworkConnection is tested by many other testcases, PlayerTest is a good example.

Method Detail

test_2_1_4_1_MultiNCs

public void test_2_1_4_1_MultiNCs()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
As a first step, verify that we can create two NetworkConnections.
Each NetworkConnection is setup with a fake SDP sourced for the property "testcase.sipphoneSDP". Both NetworkConnections are then released.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_4_2_NCLoopback

public void test_2_1_4_2_NCLoopback()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Create a pair of NetworkConnections, exchanging their local/remote SDP.
  1. Create NC1 and NC2, using NetworkConnectionConfig.BASIC as configuration
  2. Work with SdpMgr1 and SdpMgr2, the SdpPortManagers of NC1 and NC2
  3. Ask for SdpMgr1 media server SDP, do not provide UserAgent SDP: SdpMgr1.generateSdpOffer()
       --> provide SDP1
  4. Ask for SdpMgr2 media server SDP, providing SdpMgr1.mediaServerSDP as UserAgentSDP: SdpMgr2.processSdpOffer(SDP1)
       --> provide SDP2
  5. Provide SDP2 as UserAgent SDP for SdpMgr1: SdpMgr1.processSdpAnswer(SDP2)

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_1_4_3_PlayRecord

public void test_2_1_4_3_PlayRecord()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Same setup as test_2_1_4_2_NCLoopback(), then join a MediaGroup on each NetworkConnection, play on one and record on the other.
The recorded file is then compared with the originally played file.
Uses properties "testcase.promptfile" and "testcase.recordedfile".

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
